question: my 69 year old mother type 1 diabetic, allergy to aspirin, 2 strokes has disovered through an angiogram severe multiple blockages.  treatment options 1) meds- not recommended by surgeon, 2) angioplasty not a good candidate because fo angioplasty and brittle diabetes not a long term solution may need to be redone annual, some complications 3) bypass surgery- highest risk in recovery stage, may not do well with rehab risk of stroke.  Not sure if there is one good option, but we are trying to work through the grey zones.  Any sugggestions welcomed
title: bypass or angioplasty
